attributes.action: Fund renewable research and development not nuclear power stations and fracking.
attributes.additional_details:
EDF will charge the retail UK energy market a wholesale price based on energy supplied from Hinkley (the first new Nucleur reactor by 2022/23) at £92.50 per mWh, in contrast to the current wholesale price of £48 per mWh. 

Additiinally Fracking under National Parks has the go ahead. 

Solar subsidies are being reduced from a 12.03p kWh feed in tariff to 4.39p in January 2016.

We want the British Government to change its energy priorities and back renewable R&D and power.
attributes.background:
The British government is contracting EDF France and The People's Republic of China to build 3 Nucleur Reactors. They will each cost a minimum of £24bn. 

If this was spent on renewable R&D and projects we will not need nucleur power stations nor fracking and we will have clean energy.
